entry.title: The Child Trust Funds Act 2004 (Commencement No. 1) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Commencement Order brings provisions of the Child Trust Funds Act 2004 into force, which are needed from 1st January 2005 (when the phased introduction of child trust funds commences). Vouchers will begin to be issued, and accounts opened (but not funded or operated) from that date. This Order brings the relevant provisions into force, to enable those arrangements to be made.

entry.title: Limited Liability Partnerships (Records Inspection) (Fee) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under Article 657(1)(b) of the Companies (Northern Ireland) Order 1986 as applied to limited liability partnerships by regulation 4 of, and Schedule 2 to, the Limited Liability Partnerships Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004. Article 657(1)(b) enables Regulations to provide for the payment of fees in respect of the inspection of documents kept by the registrar. The fee prescribed for each inspection of records relating to one limited liability partnership is £2.

entry.title: Limited Liability Partnerships (Fees) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations are made under Article 657 of the Companies (Northern Ireland) Order 1986 as applied to limited liability partnerships by regulation 4 of, and Schedule 2 to, the Limited Liability Partnerships Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004. Article 657 enables Regulations to provide for the payment of fees in respect of certain functions performed by the registrar of companies both under the Limited Liability Partnerships Act (Northern Ireland) 2002 and under the Companies (Northern Ireland) Order 1986, as it is applied to limited liability partnerships.

entry.title: The Tax Avoidance Schemes (Prescribed Descriptions of Arrangements) (Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Tax Avoidance Schemes (Prescribed Descriptions of Arrangements) Regulations 2004 (S.I. 2004/1863: “the principal Regulations”). Their main effect is to apply similar tests, to determine whether arrangements connected with employment are notifiable, as already apply in respect of arrangements involving financial products.

entry.title: Limited Liability Partnerships (Forms) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations prescribe forms and particulars for the purposes of Articles 199, 233, 252, 371, 399, 402, 404, 405, 407, 409, 411, 413, 603A and 603D of the Companies (Northern Ireland) Order 1986 as applied to limited liability partnerships, with appropriate modifications, by the Limited Liability Partnerships Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004, (S.R. 2004 No. 307).

entry.title: The Antarctic (Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: The Regulations amend Schedule 1 to the Antarctic Regulations 1995 by adding further restricted areas, to give effect to Measure 2(2003) of the Twenty–sixth Antarctic Treaty Consultative Meeting (Madrid, 2003).

entry.title: The Business Improvement Districts (England) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision in relation to business improvement districts. Business improvement districts are provided for in Part 4 of the Local Government Act 2003 as areas within which projects specified in the BID arrangements are to be carried out for the benefit of that district or those who live, work or carry on any activity in the district. Those projects are to be financed (in whole or in part) by a BID levy imposed on the non-domestic ratepayers, or a class of such ratepayers in the district. A business improvement district may only be established where those entitled to vote approve the BID proposals.

entry.title: The Stamp Duty and Stamp Duty Reserve Tax (Extension of Exceptions relating to Recognised Exchanges) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations extend the stamp duty and stamp duty reserve tax exemptions for sales of stock to intermediaries and for repurchases and stock lending (sections 80A, 80C, 88A and 89AA of the Finance Act 1986 (c. 41)) to the market known as the Alternative Investment Market.

entry.title: The Debt Arrangement and Attachment (Scotland) Act 2002 (Commencement) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order brings into force Part 1 of the Debt Arrangement and Attachment (Scotland) Act 2002 (“the Act”)–

entry.title: The European Parliamentary (United Kingdom Representatives) Pensions (Additional Voluntary Contributions Scheme) (Amendment) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order amends the European Parliamentary (United Kingdom Representatives) Pensions (Additional Voluntary Contributions Scheme) (No. 2) Order 1995 (the “AVC Order”). Articles 3 and 4 amend the AVC Order so that AVC benefits no longer have to come into payment at the same time as an MEP’s main scheme pension benefits but can be deferred until the MEP’s 75th birthday.

entry.title: The Title Conditions (Scotland) Act 2003 (Conservation Bodies) Amendment Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order amends the Title Conditions (Scotland) Act 2003 (Conservation Bodies) Order 2003 (S.S.I. 2003/453) by adding to the list of bodies prescribed as conservation bodies. Conservation bodies are bodies in favour of whom it is competent to create a conservation burden under section 38(1) of the Title Conditions (Scotland) Act 2003 and to preserve rights to enforce real burdens by registration of a notice under section 27 or 27A of the Abolition of Feudal Tenure etc. (Scotland) Act 2000.

entry.title: The Parliamentary Pensions (Additional Voluntary Contributions Scheme) (Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Parliamentary Pensions (Additional Voluntary Contributions Scheme) Regulations 1993 (the “AVC Regulations”). Regulations 3 and 4 amend the AVC Regulations so that AVC benefits no longer have to come into payment at the same time as an MP’s main scheme pension benefits but can be deferred until the MP’s 75th birthday.

entry.title: The Common Agricultural Policy Support Schemes (Modulation) (Scotland) Amendment Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations, which come into force on 16th October 2004, amend the Common Agricultural Policy Support Schemes (Modulation) (Scotland) Regulations 2000 (“the principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Mental Health Tribunal for Scotland (Disciplinary Committee) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for the procedure to be followed by and before a disciplinary committee constituted under paragraph 5(3) of schedule 2 to the Mental Health (Care and Treatment) (Scotland) Act 2003 (asp 13). Such a disciplinary committee is constituted to carry out an investigation at the request of the Scottish Ministers in order to ascertain whether a member of the Mental Health Tribunal for Scotland is unfit for office by reason of inability, neglect of duty or misbehaviour.

entry.title: The Youth Justice and Criminal Evidence Act 1999 (Commencement No. 10) (England and Wales) Order 2004
entry.summary: This Order brings into force on 7 October 2004 section 46 of the Youth Justice and Criminal Evidence Act 1999 (“the 1999 Act”) which relates to restrictions on reporting of certain matters in relation to criminal proceedings in England and Wales.

title.div: The Care Standards Act 2000 and the Children Act 1989 (Amendment of Miscellaneous Regulations) (Wales) Regulations 2004 / Rheoliadau Deddf Safonau Gofal 2000 a Deddf Plant 1989 (Diwygio Rheoliadau Amrywiol) (Cymru) 2004

div.p: These Regulations are made in consequence of the commencement on 26 July 2004 of provisions of Part VII of the Care Standards Act 2000 establishing a list of persons considered unsuitable to work with vulnerable adults (“the list”).

Gwneir y Rheoliadau hyn o ganlyniad i gychwyn, ar 26 Gorffennaf 2004, ddarpariaethau Rhan VII o Ddeddf Safonau Gofal 2000 sy'n sefydlu rhestr o bersonau yr ystyrir eu bod yn anaddas i weithio gydag oedolion hawdd eu niweidio (“y rhestr”).

entry.title: The Social Security (Housing Benefit, State Pension Credit and Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Housing Benefit (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 (“the Housing Benefit Regulations”), the Social Security and Child Support (Decisions and Appeals) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1999, the Income Support (General) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987 (“the Income Support Regulations”), the Jobseeker’s Allowance Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1996, the State Pension Credit Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2003 and the Social Security (Claims and Payments) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 1987.

entry.title: The Parliamentary Pensions (Amendment) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations make various amendments to the Parliamentary Pensions (Consolidation and Amendment) Regulations 1993 (the “Principal Regulations”).

entry.title: The Child Support (Miscellaneous Amendments) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations provide for the amendment of regulations relating to child support.

entry.title: The Pesticides (Maximum Residue Levels in Crops, Food and Feeding Stuffs) (Scotland) Amendment (No. 3) Regulations 2004
entry.summary: These Regulations, which extend to Scotland only, further amend the provisions of the Pesticides (Maximum Residue Levels in Crops, Food and Feeding Stuffs) (Scotland) Regulations 2000 (“the principal Regulations”).
